Context: On the first day of a two-day study for a cycling magazine, four riders—Reynaldo, Seamus, Theresa, and Yuki—will each test one of four bicycles—F, G, H, and J. Each rider will then test a different one of the bicycles on the second day. Each rider tests only one bicycle per day, and all four bicycles are tested each day. The assignment of riders to bicycles is subject to the following conditions: Reynaldo cannot test F. Yuki cannot test J. Theresa must be one of the testers for H. The bicycle that Yuki tests on the first day must be tested by Seamus on the second day.
Question: If Theresa tests G on the second day, then which one of the following must be true?
Choices:
  A: Reynaldo tests H on the first day.
  B: Reynaldo tests J on the first day.
  C: Theresa tests H on the second day.
  D: Theresa tests J on the first day.
  E: Yuki tests H on the second day.

I previously answered this question incorrectly because I did not consider all of the conditions. I only considered the condition that Theresa must test H, but I did not consider the condition that Yuki cannot test J.
To answer this question correctly, I need to consider all of the conditions and use a process of elimination.
I know that Theresa must test H on one of the two days. If Theresa tests H on the second day, then she cannot test H on the first day. This means that Reynaldo must test H on the first day.
I also know that Yuki cannot test J on either day. This means that Seamus must test J on the second day.
Since Seamus tests J on the second day, he cannot test J on the first day. This means that he must test G on the first day.
Since Seamus tests G on the first day, Theresa cannot test G on the first day. This means that she must test F on the first day.
Since Theresa tests F on the first day, Reynaldo cannot test F on the first day. This means that he must test J on the first day.
Therefore, the answer is B: Reynaldo tests J on the first day.
